_header: How should I now thou fair may fall upon a sleep
Subjects: carols, lullaby; Virgin Mary, dialogue, with Christ; dialogues, Virgin and Christ
_description: Dialogue between the Virgin Mary and her Child — four 12-line stanzas with refrain, ‘It is my fader wyll’ and 4-line burden: ‘Lullay lullay my lityl chyld / Slepe & be now styll / If thou be a lytill chyld / Yitt may thou haue thi wyll’

BodAddA106.First Lines:
How suld I now þu fayre may fall apon a slepeBetter me thynke
                    þat I may fall apon & wepeFore he þat mad both nyght &
                    day cold & also hetteNow layd I am in a wispe of hay I can noder go
                    nore crepe…
BodAddA106.Last Lines:
…Bot well I wat as well I may slepe & be now styllSuffre
                    þe paynes þat I may it is my fader wyll
